title: Why New Zealand citizens are leaving the country in record numbers?
content: Government statistics revealed a record number of New Zealanders left the country due to rising unemployment and weak economic growth. In the year ending June 2024, 131,200 departures were recorded, with 75% moving to Australia. The central bank reduced interest rates to 5.25% as inflation neared its target range, indicating economic challenges for New Zealand.
summary: Government statistics revealed a record number of New Zealanders left the country due to rising unemployment and weak economic growth. In the year ending June 2024, 131,200 departures were recorded, with 75% moving to Australia. The central bank reduced interest rates to 5.25% as inflation neared its target range, indicating economic challenges for New Zealand.

title: Why did Japan's PM Kishida resign: A visionary step or compulsion?
content: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida announced he will not seek re-election in the September LDP leadership vote. Kishida's popularity had dipped due to corruption scandals, affecting public trust. Speculation is rising about potential successors, including Toshimitsu Motegi and Taro Kono, who will be elected as the new prime minister.
summary: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida announced he will not seek re-election in the September LDP leadership vote. Kishida's popularity had dipped due to corruption scandals, affecting public trust. Speculation is rising about potential successors, including Toshimitsu Motegi and Taro Kono, who will be elected as the new prime minister.

title: UK woman killed husband, hid body for 18 years before dying uncaught
content: In November 2015, the skeletal remains of John Sabine were found wrapped in plastic in Beddau, Wales. His wife, Leigh Ann Sabine, who died in October 2015, was believed to have killed him 18 years earlier. She concealed his body and continued to collect his pension until her death. The case was revealed posthumously.
summary: In November 2015, the skeletal remains of John Sabine were found wrapped in plastic in Beddau, Wales. His wife, Leigh Ann Sabine, who died in October 2015, was believed to have killed him 18 years earlier. She concealed his body and continued to collect his pension until her death. The case was revealed posthumously.

title: High doses of meth found in candy distributed by New Zealand charity
content: A New Zealand charity distributed food parcels containing candies filled with lethal amounts of methamphetamine. Approximately three grams of methamphetamine were found in the candies. The distributed parcels affected eight families, though no hospitalizations were reported. The police have launched a criminal investigation, and the charity is contacting up to 400 people to retrieve the contaminated parcels.
summary: A New Zealand charity distributed food parcels containing candies filled with lethal amounts of methamphetamine. Approximately three grams of methamphetamine were found in the candies. The distributed parcels affected eight families, though no hospitalizations were reported. The police have launched a criminal investigation, and the charity is contacting up to 400 people to retrieve the contaminated parcels.

title: Ilhan Omar wins primary race in Minnesota
content: Ilhan Omar secured her primary win in Minnesota's 5th District against Don Samuels with a 56.2%-42.9% lead. Omar, part of the progressive 'Squad,' emphasized themes of housing and healthcare rights in her victory speech. Fundraising played a crucial role, with Omar raising $6.2 million compared to Samuels' $1.4 million. Omar will now face Republican Dalia Al-Aqidi.
summary: Ilhan Omar secured her primary win in Minnesota's 5th District against Don Samuels with a 56.2%-42.9% lead. Omar, part of the progressive 'Squad,' emphasized themes of housing and healthcare rights in her victory speech. Fundraising played a crucial role, with Omar raising $6.2 million compared to Samuels' $1.4 million. Omar will now face Republican Dalia Al-Aqidi.

title: Who is Eric Hovde? Millionaire businessman who won Wisconsin's Senate GOP primary
content: Millionaire businessman Eric Hovde won the Wisconsin GOP Senate primary, defeating two minor candidates. He will now challenge Democratic Senator Tammy Baldwin in the upcoming election. Hovde, endorsed by former President Trump, aims to reduce costs, secure the border, and address healthcare issues. Baldwin portrays Hovde as a wealthy outsider out of touch with voters.
summary: Millionaire businessman Eric Hovde won the Wisconsin GOP Senate primary, defeating two minor candidates. He will now challenge Democratic Senator Tammy Baldwin in the upcoming election. Hovde, endorsed by former President Trump, aims to reduce costs, secure the border, and address healthcare issues. Baldwin portrays Hovde as a wealthy outsider out of touch with voters.

title: 'Biggest political corruption scandal': Hunter Biden sought US assistance in Burisma deal, says report
content: Hunter Biden reportedly sought help from the US Ambassador to Italy in 2016 to secure a deal for Burisma, a Ukrainian gas company where he was a board member, while his father was Vice President. The White House confirmed President Biden was unaware of this outreach. No meetings or projects materialized from Hunter Biden's requests.
summary: Hunter Biden reportedly sought help from the US Ambassador to Italy in 2016 to secure a deal for Burisma, a Ukrainian gas company where he was a board member, while his father was Vice President. The White House confirmed President Biden was unaware of this outreach. No meetings or projects materialized from Hunter Biden's requests.

title: Watch: Nasa astronaut shares timelapse video showing Moon setting behind Earth amid auroras
content: Nasa astronaut Matthew Dominick recently shared a captivating timelapse video from the International Space Station showing the moon setting amidst vibrant auroras. The video, captured with a new lens, highlighted the impact of recent solar eruptions. These geomagnetic storms have intensified, producing remarkable aurora displays. Dominick's footage has attracted significant attention, showcasing stunning visuals observed from 420 kilometers above Earth.
summary: Nasa astronaut Matthew Dominick recently shared a captivating timelapse video from the International Space Station showing the moon setting amidst vibrant auroras. The video, captured with a new lens, highlighted the impact of recent solar eruptions. These geomagnetic storms have intensified, producing remarkable aurora displays. Dominick's footage has attracted significant attention, showcasing stunning visuals observed from 420 kilometers above Earth.

title: After Kursk, Russia declares emergency in Belgorod amid increased Ukrainian attacks
content: Russian Belgorod governor Vyacheslav Gladkov declared a regional emergency after continuous Ukrainian attacks destroyed homes and caused civilian casualties. This move follows similar federal-level emergencies. Simultaneously, a Russian missile hit a Ukrainian shopping mall, resulting in numerous deaths and injuries, as the conflict between Russia and Ukraine persists since the February 2022 invasion.
summary: Russian Belgorod governor Vyacheslav Gladkov declared a regional emergency after continuous Ukrainian attacks destroyed homes and caused civilian casualties. This move follows similar federal-level emergencies. Simultaneously, a Russian missile hit a Ukrainian shopping mall, resulting in numerous deaths and injuries, as the conflict between Russia and Ukraine persists since the February 2022 invasion.

title: Putin brings in his ex-bodyguard to counter Ukrainian incursion
content: President Putin appointed Alexey Dyumin, a trusted aide and former bodyguard, to oversee military and civilian operations in Russia’s Kursk region amid Ukraine’s incursion. Dyumin, recently named secretary of the State Council, is tasked with reporting back to Putin while reinforcements are sent to address the conflict. Ukraine’s incursion in Kursk is the biggest assault within Russia since 2022.
summary: President Putin appointed Alexey Dyumin, a trusted aide and former bodyguard, to oversee military and civilian operations in Russia’s Kursk region amid Ukraine’s incursion. Dyumin, recently named secretary of the State Council, is tasked with reporting back to Putin while reinforcements are sent to address the conflict. Ukraine’s incursion in Kursk is the biggest assault within Russia since 2022.

title: Tropical storm Ernesto likely to intensify into hurricane in Atlantic
content: Tropical Storm Ernesto is forecasted to strengthen into a hurricane, moving north of the Greater Antilles. It'll impact the Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, and Puerto Rico with substantial rainfall and potential storm surge. Puerto Rico remained under tropical storm warning with mobilized national guard and postponed public school classes for preparation.
summary: Tropical Storm Ernesto is forecasted to strengthen into a hurricane, moving north of the Greater Antilles. It'll impact the Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, and Puerto Rico with substantial rainfall and potential storm surge. Puerto Rico remained under tropical storm warning with mobilized national guard and postponed public school classes for preparation.

title: Japan's Kishida tells his ruling party he will not run in its September leadership vote, NHK says
'No tax on tips': Trump and Harris find common ground as a populist stance
content: In the US presidential campaign, Trump and Harris surprisingly agreed that workers' tips should not be taxed. While their populist proposal gained traction among service-sector workers, it faced criticism for economic irresponsibility. Economists argued it could create inequities among workers. The specifics remain unclear, but potential costs could exceed $107 billion over a decade.
summary: In the US presidential campaign, Trump and Harris surprisingly agreed that workers' tips should not be taxed. While their populist proposal gained traction among service-sector workers, it faced criticism for economic irresponsibility. Economists argued it could create inequities among workers. The specifics remain unclear, but potential costs could exceed $107 billion over a decade.

title: Watch: Two toddlers found stranded on Texas highway after accident
content: A video of two toddlers in diapers wandering on a Texas highway after being ejected from a flipped car is circulating online. The accident occurred on Interstate 10 East Freeway, involving two vehicles. The toddlers and an adult were hospitalized but are in good condition. Authorities are investigating the crash that left the other driver uninjured.
summary: A video of two toddlers in diapers wandering on a Texas highway after being ejected from a flipped car is circulating online. The accident occurred on Interstate 10 East Freeway, involving two vehicles. The toddlers and an adult were hospitalized but are in good condition. Authorities are investigating the crash that left the other driver uninjured.

title: US approves $20 billion weapons sale to Israel despite concerns
content: The Biden administration approved a $20 billion weapons sale to Israel despite activists' opposition due to Gaza's casualties. The state department announced 50 F-15 jets, tank cartridges, and military vehicles for Israel, emphasizing national security interests. Rescuers reported civilian deaths in Gaza from Israeli airstrikes, but the US did not confirm involvement of American-supplied arms.
summary: The Biden administration approved a $20 billion weapons sale to Israel despite activists' opposition due to Gaza's casualties. The state department announced 50 F-15 jets, tank cartridges, and military vehicles for Israel, emphasizing national security interests. Rescuers reported civilian deaths in Gaza from Israeli airstrikes, but the US did not confirm involvement of American-supplied arms.

title: Only Gaza ceasefire can delay Iran response to killing of Hamas chief by Israel: Report
Russia 'pauses' Ukraine's incursion; Kyiv says 74 areas in its control, but occupation not the goal
content: Russian forces repelled a Ukrainian attempt to further incursion in the Kursk region, halting armoured groups near several settlements. Kyiv stated the operation aimed to protect Ukraine from long-range attacks originating from Kursk. Ukraine's military commander reported control over 74 settlements and 40sqkm gained in the past day.
summary: Russian forces repelled a Ukrainian attempt to further incursion in the Kursk region, halting armoured groups near several settlements. Kyiv stated the operation aimed to protect Ukraine from long-range attacks originating from Kursk. Ukraine's military commander reported control over 74 settlements and 40sqkm gained in the past day.

title: Trump flies on jet previously owned by Jeffrey Epstein
The University that made Kamala Harris
Kamala Harris worked at McDonald's, can you picture Trump doing it: Tim Walz
content: "Vice President Harris grew up in a middle class family and picked up shifts at McDonald’s. Can you picture Donald Trump working at a McDonald's trying to make a McFlurry or something? He couldn't run that damn McFlurry machine," Tim said.
summary: "Vice President Harris grew up in a middle class family and picked up shifts at McDonald’s. Can you picture Donald Trump working at a McDonald's trying to make a McFlurry or something? He couldn't run that damn McFlurry machine," Tim said.
